47 years later, we must pass the ROE Act to protect access to abortion care.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
Take Action Now

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

On this day 47 years ago, the U.S. Supreme Court issued its landmark decision in Roe v. Wade, recognizing the constitutional right to abortion. The Court's ruling heralded a promising future, in which people could take control of their bodies and their health care, gaining equal opportunity for employment and the power to pursue happy, prosperous lives.

Almost immediately, lawmakers in Massachusetts passed a slew of restrictions with the aim of limiting abortion access in the wake of Roe v. Wade. Many of these regressive laws are still on the books today, delaying or preventing people from receiving the care they need.

That's why the ACLU and its partners are fighting to pass the ROE Act. This crucial bill will improve access to abortion in our state by dismantling unjust barriers to care. SEND A MESSAGE: state lawmakers must act to ensure that abortion is safe and accessible to all who seek care.

47 years ago, civil liberties advocates made history in Roe v. Wade. Now, as abortion access is under attack across the country as never before, the people of Massachusetts can – and must – continue to forge a path for reproductive freedom. We should pressure our lawmakers to act, because the future of abortion care depends on it.

In solidarity,

ACLU of Massachusetts
